page.title: 01STANLEY & OUTWOOD-GENERAL
page.content: THIS AREA IN THE PAST WAS DOMINATED BY COAL MINING,SIGNS OF WHICH STILL REMAIN (SEE PAGE 14).MANY MINERS' FAMILIES FACED HARDSHIP AND TRIBULATION WHICH LED TO CLOSELY-KNIT, SUPPORTIVE COMMUNITIES WHICH STILL EXIST DESPITE THE CESSATION OF MINING AND THE REMOVAL OF MANY MINERS TO THE NEW COALFIELD AT SELBY.APART FROM A SMALL MINORITY WHO WORK ON THE LAND, MOST PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED IN LOCAL ADMINISTRATION,HOSPITALS,PUBLIC SERVICES,POLICE,PRISON SERVICE,BANKS, INSURANCE,BUILDING AND DISTRIBUTIVE TRADES WITHIN A FIVE-MILE RADIUS. DURING THE LAST TEN YEARS THERE HAS BEEN A MARKED INCREASE IN IMMIGRANTS FROM HONGKONG (WHO HAVE OPENED CHINESE FOOD TAKE-AWAYS)AND INDIA-PAKISTAN (MAINLY SHOP OWNERS OR PROFFESIONAL MEN). {
